channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Big Tech's AI Race Has One Main Winner: Nvidia
item.description: Amazon joins Microsoft and Google in blowout capital spending with mixed business results, while Intel posted disappointing second-quarter results.

item.title: Chevron earnings miss on lower refining margins, relocates headquarters to Houston
item.description: The results come as the Chevron-Hess deal is delayed until well into 2025 due to an arbitration case with ExxonMobil.

item.title: Is Trump Really Better Than Harris for Oil and Gas Investors?
item.description: The former president wants the U.S. to “drill, baby, drill,” while Vice President Kamala Harris doesn’t. But figuring out which one is more favorable to the industry is tricky.

item.title: Exxon earnings beat as production in Guyana and Permian sets a record
item.description: ExxonMobil on Friday posted its second highest results for the second quarter in the past decade, helped by record production in Guyana and the Permian Basin.

item.title: The Stock That Took Investors on a $90 Billion Ride
item.description: QXO, backed by Jared Kushner, lost $90 billion in market value, but the only rule broken was the Law of One Price.

item.title: Why all semiconductor firms are not benefiting from the AI boom like Nvidia has
item.description: Not all chip firms are benefiting from the boom in artificial intelligence, earnings show, underscoring the complexities of the semiconductor supply chain.

item.title: Japanese Stocks Suffer Biggest Fall Since 2020 on Economic Concerns
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average posted its largest single-day drop in more than four years, driven down by signs of cooling in the U.S. economy and an interest-rate increase by the Bank of Japan.

item.title: Nintendo profit falls 55% as sales of its ageing Switch console plunge
item.description: Nintendo sold 2.1 million units of its flagship Switch consoles, down 46% from the 3.91 million units it sold in the year ago period.

item.title: Weak Economic Data Prompts Stock Selloff
item.description: Yield on 10-year Treasury note slides below 4% while drugmaker Moderna’s shares take a dive on Thursday.

item.title: Intel to cut 15% of workforce, reports quarterly guidance miss
item.description: Intel will say goodbye to 15,000 employees, cut capital expenditures and forgo a fourth-quarter dividend following weak results and quarterly guidance.
